summary: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) review state spending reports to verify that states appropriately spent their federal Medicaid funds. CMS reviewers have saved over $5 billion in the past 4 years by identifying errors in state spending reports—finding expenditures that lacked supporting data or were not allowed under Medicaid rules. Could they be finding more? CMS may be missing chances to save...
title: Medicaid: CMS Needs to Better Target Risks to Improve Oversight of Expenditures
